intro: Alopecurus fulvus subsp. intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate false oat, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences with inconspicuous flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in areas with moderate to high moisture levels. Its botanical features make it a common indicator species in certain ecological contexts.
